Alright! Everybody in their seats now! (she snaps her fingers) Hey, you, sit down. People settle into their seats. Ryan manages to squeeze i to Martina. He smiles at her, flirtatiously. Cynthia thro Ryan a look, and he gets up and goes to sit with her.

(speaking very quickly) I'd like to apologize on behalf of the family for all of the distractions. I hope that everyone is settled and ready to continue with the service. Aaron, the oldest son, would like to say a few words about his father. Michelle gives Aaron an encouraging look as he makes his the front. Aaron clears his throat and prepares to begin. The room i absolutely silent. He takes a deep breath. ANGLE ON: The reverend nodding for Aaron to hurry up. ANGLE ON: Aaron.
My father... was an exceptional--

Suddenly, a loud banging emanates from the coffin. Everyo stares at it in stunned silence. Jeff looks over to Norma whose eyes are as wide as saucers. Aaron looks like a dee caught in headlights. He looks at Ryan who gestures to hi continue. He nervously struggles on.
My father was an exceptional man.
Everyone stares at the coffin in awe. Aaron bravely conti
Not only did he live for his family, but he was always there for others--
What the hell is going on?
There's someone in there!

I knew it! I knew it! Suddenly the coffin lid flips off and everyone stares in as Frank sits up, looking like a crazy person, and babbli incoherently. Several people scream. Frank opens the other end of the c and looks at his dead lover.
(trying to cover) What the hell are you doing in my Dad's coffin? Frank starts grabbing at Edward's body screaming.
Edward! Edward! Edward! Ryan, Norman and Jeff try to pull Frank out of the coffin he's holding onto the corpse.

No! No! Finally they get Frank out and carry him from the room. Her face turn horror as she makes out the image. The noise in the room broken by Cynthia's furious cry. She drops the photos and at Frank.
You bastard! Cynthia tackles Frank and starts beating him.
(as she hits him) He was with you! Duncan picks up the photos. He shows them to Uncle Russel
I always thought he had a little sugar in his tank. Everything has descended into total chaos until Aaron fin shouts across the room.

head_text.subj: MY FATHER WAS AN EXCEPTIONAL MAN

text: Everyone, including Frank and Cynthia, looks at Aaron, st They all freeze. There's a long silence.

He had his... shortcomings, but he took care of his family. He loved his family. He loved this house. He worked hard. All I wanted today was to show him how much we all loved and admired him. To give him the respect that he deserved... Is that really so much to ask? We all get so distracted by the... little things in life. We forget about the important things. Like the fact that we lost a great man. The mourners look up at Aaron with undivided attention.

So maybe he loved "Dreamgirls" more than most men. We don't know why a man makes the choices he makes. But I do know that my father made the best choices he could make. Life is complicated. We're just thrown here together in a world filled with chaos and confusion... and we do our best. And Dad did his best... Aaron looks over at the coffin. As.he speaks, we see shot Cynthia, Frank, Jeff, Norman, Duncan as they are moved by Aaron's words.
He taught us to go for what we wanted in life, because you never know how long you're going to be here... And whether you succeed... or you fail... the important thing is that you tried.
A beat. Michelle looks up at her husband with pride. We s the various other mourners looking at Aaron and listening

So when you all leave here today, I want you to remember Dad for who he really was... A decent, loving man who never condemned anyone for how they lived. Who never cast disparaging remarks or held prejudices against race, gender... height. If only we could all be as giving, as generous, as understanding as my father... Even dead, my father has more character than everyone in this room. If I am half the man my father was, my child will be incredibly blessed. Aaron turns and walks out of the room. Everyone watches h Michelle follows him out of the room.
The house has emptied out. All the cars are gone.
Aaron is laying on the couch, looking drained. Ryan comes the stairs. It looks like he's had some time to recover. walks over and takes a seat.
How's Mom?
She's resting. A beat.
I've asked Mom to come live with me for awhile. It'll give you and Michelle a chance to breathe a bit, you know. Move and everything. Aaron looks at Ryan, surprised.
